::Firearm::

Firearm sadly shakes his head. It was obvious that Spears had cared 
for Striker in some way.

"The device we used to disable the Trainer chip in you didn't work on 
Striker at all. He might have been reprogrammed, in which case they 
probably cleared his memory. If that's true, there's not way to get 
him back."

He pats her on the shoulder, "I'm really sorry about what happened."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Spears::
> 
> She took his arm and stood up. Her was a little wobbly, but 
> reasonably ok. She looked at Firearm with fear in her 
eyes. "Striker 
> is...one of them...and no way to get him back?"
> She looked at Firearm, but stared off into space. Her spark beat a 
> million beats a second. "He's...gone." she said in a shocked voice.
> 
> "No..I can't believe it. I won't believe it."  Her love for him 
> wouldn't give up on him yet. "No, there has to be a way to save 
him."
> 
> She shook her head trying to clear it. "You said I was taken too, 
but 
> I'm here now. Can we save him the same way you saved me?"
